issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I've noticed the SC(s) are frequently transitioning  to 'not ready' state during windows BFEBS churn tests. I'm using a 12gig ebs backed windows image, and running 4 concurrent instances from this image/snapshot across 2 clusters (2 per cluster).  During this load it seems that at least one of the SCs will go into 'not ready' state. 
The current assumption is due to IO load, but opening this ticket for further investigation. 
Thanks, 
-Matt 

From SC cloud-error.log:
{code}

fields.summary: Remote SC transitions to Not-Ready state often in BFEBS load tests
fields.environment:
GIT_REPO	git+ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal#maint/3.4/testing
GIT_HASH	e471e76b16669a1ee78a83a527843050da16d348

10.111.1.46	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS]
10.111.1.56	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.76	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.77	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC01 SC01]
10.111.5.176	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC01]

SAN_PROVIDER=EquallogicProvider

comments.body: Closing this issue. After further investigation it appears that there were too many QA test clouds running against a shared single  EQ SAN. This san has a limited number of admin connections (7 I believe) and the tests were competing for the resources. This transition would be by design then.
